API Documentation¶

A full guide to all resources provided by the Media Centre API.

The API is also self-documenting, GET /api/v1/ is a great starting point.

Appending /schema/ to any Resource will get a description of that Resource.

The API root is at http://api.tim-garner.co.uk/

Film¶

GET /api/v1/film/?name¶
Opt. params:name – Search for Film containing name

Retrieve list of Films

GET /api/v1/film/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id – An id

Retrieve Film matching given id.

POST /api/v1/film/¶
Responses:202 – A Film was created successfully.

Create a Film

POST /api/v1/film/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id – An id
Responses:202 – The Film was updated successfully.

Update Film matching given id

Note

PATCH and PUT are both available and work in a similar fashion to POST

DELETE /api/v1/film/¶
Responses:202 – The Films were deleted successfully.

Delete all Films

DELETE /api/v1/film/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id – An id
Responses:202 – The Film was deleted successfully.

Delete film

FilmSeries¶

GET /api/v1/filmseries/?name¶
Opt. params:name –

Search for Filmseries containing name

Retrieve list of Filmseriess
GET /api/v1/filmseries/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

Retrieve Filmseries matching given id.
POST /api/v1/filmseries/¶
Responses:202 –

A Filmseries was created successfully.

Create a Filmseries
POST /api/v1/filmseries/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

response 202:The Filmseries was updated successfully.

Update Filmseries matching given id

Note

PATCH and PUT are both available and work in a similar fashion to POST

DELETE /api/v1/filmseries/¶
Responses:202 – The Filmseriess were deleted successfully.

Delete all Filmseriess

DELETE /api/v1/filmseries/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id – An id
Responses:202 – The Filmseries was deleted successfully.

Delete filmseries

Episode¶

GET /api/v1/episode/?name¶
Opt. params:name –

Search for Episode containing name

Retrieve list of Episodes
GET /api/v1/episode/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

Retrieve Episode matching given id.
POST /api/v1/episode/¶
Responses:202 –

A Episode was created successfully.

Create a Episode
POST /api/v1/episode/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

response 202:The Episode was updated successfully.

Update Episode matching given id

Note

PATCH and PUT are both available and work in a similar fashion to POST

DELETE /api/v1/episode/¶
Responses:202 – The Episodes were deleted successfully.

Delete all Episodes

DELETE /api/v1/episode/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id – An id
Responses:202 – The Episode was deleted successfully.

Delete episode

Show¶

GET /api/v1/show/?name¶
Opt. params:name –

Search for Show containing name

Retrieve list of Shows
GET /api/v1/show/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

Retrieve Show matching given id.
POST /api/v1/show/¶
Responses:202 –

A Show was created successfully.

Create a Show
POST /api/v1/show/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

response 202:The Show was updated successfully.

Update Show matching given id

Note

PATCH and PUT are both available and work in a similar fashion to POST

DELETE /api/v1/show/¶
Responses:202 – The Shows were deleted successfully.

Delete all Shows

DELETE /api/v1/show/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id – An id
Responses:202 – The Show was deleted successfully.

Delete show

Content¶

Warning

Content is the parent of Film and Episode Resources. You cannot directly create, update or delete a Content Resource.

GET /api/v1/content/?name¶
Opt. params:name –

Search for Content containing name

Retrieve list of Contents
GET /api/v1/content/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

Retrieve Content matching given id.

Playlist¶

GET /api/v1/playlist/?name¶
Opt. params:name –

Search for Playlist containing name

Retrieve list of Playlists
GET /api/v1/playlist/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

Retrieve Playlist matching given id.
POST /api/v1/playlist/¶
Responses:202 –

A Playlist was created successfully.

Create a Playlist
POST /api/v1/playlist/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id –

An id

response 202:The Playlist was updated successfully.

Update Playlist matching given id

Note

PATCH and PUT are both available and work in a similar fashion to POST

DELETE /api/v1/playlist/¶
Responses:202 – The Playlists were deleted successfully.

Delete all Playlists

DELETE /api/v1/playlist/{id}/¶
Path arguments:id – An id
Responses:202 – The Playlist was deleted successfully.

Delete playlist

Player¶

Note

There is only one Player, you cannot create, update or delete it.

GET /api/v1/player/?action¶
Opt. params:action – Command player to perform action. Actions available: play, pause, stop, back, next.

Retrieve Player
